Entry.JapaneseText: <Dio>
Entry.EnglishText: <Dio>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Suzu>
Entry.EnglishText: <Suzu>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Rondoline>
Entry.EnglishText: <Rondoline>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mel>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mel>

Entry.JapaneseText: Variable
ヴォルトがいるのって まだ先か？
Entry.EnglishText: Volt is a little deeper in, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: 私もヴォルトには会ったこと がないので正確ではありませんが、 あと少しだと思います
Entry.EnglishText: I have not actually met with Volt so I cannot be completely sure but I do believe we are very close.

Entry.JapaneseText: 指輪にマナが少しずつ 溜まってきてる…… 精霊さんが近くにいる証拠だね
Entry.EnglishText: My ring is starting to collect itty bits of Mana so Mister Summon Spirit mustn't be too far away!

Entry.JapaneseText: その指輪、便利だよな、 いろいろ
Entry.EnglishText: That ring sure comes in handy for a lot of things.

Entry.JapaneseText: もしかして、それくれた人、 <Rody>さんのこと、 好きだったんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Is it possible...That the person that gave you the ring is someone you like?

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか。 んなわけないって
Entry.EnglishText: There you go and ask it if it was that simple!

Entry.JapaneseText: 相手は大人だし、 私はまだお子ちゃまだったしさ
Entry.EnglishText: He's a lot older than me, a grown up adult. I've known him since I was a kid so it's more like a childhood friend.

Entry.JapaneseText: どんな人だったんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: What kind of person is he like?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……うーん…… 冷たい人？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Mmm...A cold person?

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、温かい人
Entry.EnglishText: But he's also very kind.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、そりゃ
Entry.EnglishText: That doesn't make a lick of sense.

Entry.JapaneseText: 必死に探してても、 出てこないくせに
Entry.EnglishText: He looked like he carried a troubled life and hardly ever opened up.

Entry.JapaneseText: 寂しくて空見上げてたら そっと出てくる気まぐれさん
Entry.EnglishText: Sometimes when he felt sad he'd look at the sky and his moody side would occasionally come out.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんかヤなヤツだな
Entry.EnglishText: This only gets weirder...

Entry.JapaneseText: きっと照れ屋さんなんだよ
Entry.EnglishText: Sounds like a really shy person!

Entry.JapaneseText: 私もヤなヤツって思った
Entry.EnglishText: Honestly, I'm here with <Dio>. Super weird guy.

Entry.JapaneseText: で、ボソボソ話すんだよ、 空には絶対、動かない星が あるってことを
Entry.EnglishText: Like he'd murmur sometimes something about a star in the sky that never moved no matter what.

Entry.JapaneseText: あ、それって “北の真ん中星”のことだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, isn't that...the "Northern Middle Star"?

Entry.JapaneseText: そう。そん時は私、 何それって思ったの
Entry.EnglishText: Right. I had no idea what it was back then, though.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、ある時ね、森の奥で迷子に なって泣きそうになってたら、 ふとあいつの話を思い出して
Entry.EnglishText: But...there was this time when I got lost inside the forest as a kid. I was crying a lot and I suddenly remembered what he said.

Entry.JapaneseText: その星を目印に 家に戻ったわけですね？
Entry.EnglishText: So you used that star he talked about to guide yourself home?

Entry.JapaneseText: うん。まぁ、そんな話
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, you could put it that way.

Entry.JapaneseText: さぁ、行こ行こ、 “北の真ん中星”目印にさ
Entry.EnglishText: All right, let's go! To find our "Northern Middle Star" landmark!

Entry.JapaneseText: 目印にと言っても、 ここは洞窟ですから……
Entry.EnglishText: You speak of sky landmarks but...we're inside a cave....

Entry.JapaneseText: たとえ話だよ。ほらほら
Entry.EnglishText: That was an example! Geez, Louise!

Entry.JapaneseText: どんな心細い時にも いつもあなたの記憶が 私とともにあるんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Every time things looked impossible you were there. Always there for me...
